## <center>Data </center>
```{r}
x03 = read.table("https://people.sc.fsu.edu/~jburkardt/datasets/regression/x03.txt", skip = 36)
names(x03) = c("Index", "One", "Age", "Systolic Blood Pressure")
names(x03) = c("I", "A1", "A2", "B")
```

---
class: middle
## Data Table
```{r}
kable(x03)
```

---

## Histogram For Normality Check
```{r}
hist(x03$B)
```
---

## Building the Model
```{r}
Model <- lm(B ~ A2, data = x03)
summary(Model)
```
---
## Interpretation
From our model, we have a linear regression B = 0.97A2 + 98.71. The model has a multiple r-squared value of 0.432. This means that our model explains 43.2% of the variation within systolic blood pressure. This means that age helps to explain some of the variation, but not as much as we would like.
